answers.answer: Sounds like nerve pain.  Nerve pain can be quite painful.  Start with a chiropractor.  Chiropractors work on the nerves, muscles, and bones.  A chiropractor will know if there is something else going on and can order an MRI.

question: Hello, I am a 30 yr old female, height is 5'6, weith is 130lbs, no family cardiac history, mother has htn, no histories for me except for preeclampsia in 2008. I have been having left shoulder, arm pain, tingling and numbness and left sided chestpain right under my left breast since feb 2009, sometimes back pain, no other symptoms except for when these events occur, i get panicky.  these episodes occur whether am standing, sitting or what ever, it just comes and goes. I have been to the ER 4 times already this year, have seen about 2 cardiologists, I have had an echocardiogram, a stress test, numerous EKGS, CT scan of my chest, chest x rays, cardiac markers, all came back negative, yet still the pain in the left arm and chest pain, my doctor has tried to assure me that my heart is in perfect condition, but when these episodes occur, they cause me a great deal of anxiety and panic. I don't know who else to see. I am just so afraid sometimes to go to sleep at night. please help if u can.thanks
title: undiagnosed chestpain
